info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 25 at 2:57AM MDT until March 27 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MDT EARLY THIS MORNING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO MIDNIGHT MDT SUNDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations up to 2 inches in the valleys, and up to 4 inches in the mountains. Winds gusting to as high as 35 mph through some valleys. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 5 inches, and up to 10 inches in the mountains. * WHERE...Beaverhead and Western Madison below 6000ft and Northwest Beaverhead County. * WHEN...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 AM MDT early this morning. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, from 6 PM this evening to Midnight MDT Sunday Night. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Periods of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Icy roads will become snow covered, making travel especially difficult.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock.
